1508        }
1509        if (impassable != null && !impassable.isEmpty()) {
1510            for (Coord pt : impassable) {
1511                if(pt != null && pt.isWithin(width, height)) {
1512                    for (int xs = pt.x, xi = 0; xi < size && xs >= 0; xs--, xi++) {
1513                        for (int ys = pt.y, yi = 0; yi < size && ys >= 0; ys--, yi++) {
1514                            gradientClone[xs][ys] = physicalMap[xs][ys];
1515                        }
1516                    }
1517                }
1518            }
1519        }
1520        gradientMap = gradientClone;
1521    }
1522
1523
1524    /**
1525     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map for a creature that is potentially larger than 1x1 cell and return it. The value of
1526     * a cell in the returned Dijkstra map assumes that a creature is square, with a side length equal to the passed
1527     * size, that its minimum-x, minimum-y cell is the starting cell, and that any cell with a distance number
1528     * represents the distance for the creature's minimum-x, minimum-y cell to reach it. Cells that cannot be entered
1529     * by the minimum-x, minimum-y cell because of sizing (such as a floor cell next to a maximum-x and/or maximum-y
1530     * wall if size is &gt; 1) will be marked as DARK. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
1531     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
1532     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. The exceptions are walls,
1533     * which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan was
1534     * unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class. (typically,
1535     * these areas should not be used to place NPCs or items and should be filled with walls). This uses the
1536     * current measurement.  The result is stored in the {@link #gradientMap} field and a copy is returned.
1537     *
1538     * @param impassable A Collection of Coord keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
1539     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
1540     * @param size       The length of one side of a square creature using this to find a path, i.e. 2 for a 2x2 cell
1541     *                   creature. Non-square creatures are not supported because turning is really hard.
1542     * @return A 2D double[width][height] using the width and height of what this knows about the physical map.
1543     */
1544    public double[][] partialScan(final int limit, final Collection<Coord> impassable, final int size) {
1545        partialScan(limit,null, impassable, size);
1546        double[][] gradientClone = new double[width][height];
1547        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1548            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1549                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
1550                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
1551                }
1552            }
1553            System.arraycopy(gradientMap[x], 0, gradientClone[x], 0, height);
1554        }
1555        return gradientClone;
1556
1557    }
1558
1559    /**
1560     * Recalculate the Dijkstra map for a creature that is potentially larger than 1x1 cell and return it. The value of
1561     * a cell in the returned Dijkstra map assumes that a creature is square, with a side length equal to the passed
1562     * size, that its minimum-x, minimum-y cell is the starting cell, and that any cell with a distance number
1563     * represents the distance for the creature's minimum-x, minimum-y cell to reach it. Cells that cannot be entered
1564     * by the minimum-x, minimum-y cell because of sizing (such as a floor cell next to a maximum-x and/or maximum-y
1565     * wall if size is &gt; 1) will be marked as DARK. Cells that were marked as goals with setGoal will have
1566     * a value of 0, the cells adjacent to goals will have a value of 1, and cells progressively further
1567     * from goals will have a value equal to the distance from the nearest goal. The exceptions are walls,
1568     * which will have a value defined by the WALL constant in this class, and areas that the scan was
1569     * unable to reach, which will have a value defined by the DARK constant in this class. (typically,
1570     * these areas should not be used to place NPCs or items and should be filled with walls). This uses the
1571     * current measurement.  The result is stored in the {@link #gradientMap} field, and nothing is returned.
1572     * If you want the data returned, you can use {@link #partialScan(int, Collection, int)} (which calls this method
1573     * with null for the start parameter, then modifies the gradientMap field and returns a copy), or you can
1574     * just retrieve the gradientMap (maybe copying it; {@link squidpony.ArrayTools#copy(double[][])} is a
1575     * convenient option for copying a 2D double array). If start is non-null, which is usually used when
1576     * finding a single path, then cells that didn't need to be explored (because they were further than the
1577     * path needed to go from start to goal) will have the value {@link #FLOOR}. You may wish to assign a
1578     * different value to these cells in some cases (especially if start is null, which means any cells that
1579     * are still FLOOR could not be reached from any goal), and the overloads of partialScan that return 2D double
1580     * arrays do change FLOOR to {@link #DARK}, which is usually treated similarly to {@link #WALL}.
1581     *
1582     * @param impassable A Collection of Coord keys representing the locations of enemies or other moving obstacles to a
1583     *                   path that cannot be moved through; this can be null if there are no such obstacles.
1584     * @param size       The length of one side of a square creature using this to find a path, i.e. 2 for a 2x2 cell
1585     *                   creature. Non-square creatures are not supported because turning is really hard.
1586     */
1587    public void partialScan(final int limit, final Coord start, final Collection<Coord> impassable, final int size) {
1588
1589        if (!initialized || limit <= 0) return;
1590        double[][] gradientClone = ArrayTools.copy(gradientMap);
1591        if (impassable != null && !impassable.isEmpty()) {
1592            for (Coord pt : impassable) {
1593                if(pt != null && pt.isWithin(width, height))
1594                    gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] = WALL;
1595            }
1596        }
1597        for (int xx = size; xx < width; xx++) {
1598            for (int yy = size; yy < height; yy++) {
1599                if(gradientMap[xx][yy] > FLOOR) {
1600                    for (int xs = xx, xi = 0; xi < size && xs >= 0; xs--, xi++) {
1601                        for (int ys = yy, yi = 0; yi < size && ys >= 0; ys--, yi++) {
1602                            gradientClone[xs][ys] = WALL;
1603                        }
1604                    }
1605                }
1606            }
1607        }
1608        int dec, adjX, adjY, cen, cenX, cenY;
1609
1610        PER_GOAL:
1611        for (int i = 0; i < goals.size; i++) {
1612            dec = goals.get(i);
1613            for (int xs = decodeX(dec), xi = 0; xi < size && xs >= 0; xs--, xi++) {
1614                for (int ys = decodeY(dec), yi = 0; yi < size && ys >= 0; ys--, yi++) {
1615                    if(physicalMap[xs][ys] > FLOOR)
1616                        continue PER_GOAL;
1617                    gradientClone[xs][ys] = GOAL;
1618                }
1619            }
1620        }
1621        double currentLowest = 999000, cs, dist;
1622        fresh.clear();
1623        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1624            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1625                if (gradientClone[x][y] <= FLOOR) {
1626                    if (gradientClone[x][y] < currentLowest) {
1627                        currentLowest = gradientClone[x][y];
1628                        fresh.clear();
1629                        fresh.add(encode(x, y));
1630                    } else if (gradientClone[x][y] == currentLowest) {
1631                        fresh.add(encode(x, y));
1632                    }
1633                }
1634            }
1635        }
1636        int fsz, numAssigned = fresh.size;
1637        mappedCount = goals.size;
1638        Direction[] moveDirs = (measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN) ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
1639
1640        int iter = 0;
1641        while (numAssigned > 0 && iter++ < limit) {
1642            numAssigned = 0;
1643            fsz = fresh.size;
1644            for (int ci = fsz-1; ci >= 0; ci--) {
1645                cen = fresh.removeIndex(ci);
1646                cenX = decodeX(cen);
1647                cenY = decodeY(cen);
1648                dist = gradientClone[cenX][cenY];
1649
1650                for (int d = 0; d < moveDirs.length; d++) {
1651                    adjX = cenX + moveDirs[d].deltaX;
1652                    adjY = cenY + moveDirs[d].deltaY;
1653                    if (adjX < 0 || adjY < 0 || width <= adjX || height <= adjY)
1654                        /* Outside the map */
1655                        continue;
1656                    if(d >= 4 && blockingRequirement > 0) // diagonal
1657                    {
1658                        if((gradientClone[adjX][cenY] > FLOOR ? 1 : 0)
1659                                + (gradientClone[cenX][adjY] > FLOOR ? 1 : 0)
1660                                >= blockingRequirement)
1661                        {
1662                            continue;
1663                        }
1664                    }
1665                    double h = measurement.heuristic(moveDirs[d]);
1666                    cs = dist + h * costMap[adjX][adjY];
1667                    if (gradientClone[adjX][adjY] <= FLOOR && cs < gradientClone[adjX][adjY]) {
1668                        setFresh(adjX, adjY, cs);
1669                        ++numAssigned;
1670                        ++mappedCount;
1671                        if(start != null && start.x == adjX && start.y == adjY && standardCosts)
1672                        {
1673                            if (impassable != null && !impassable.isEmpty()) {
1674                                for (Coord pt : impassable) {
1675                                    if(pt != null && pt.isWithin(width, height)) {
1676                                        for (int xs = pt.x, xi = 0; xi < size && xs >= 0; xs--, xi++) {
1677                                            for (int ys = pt.y, yi = 0; yi < size && ys >= 0; ys--, yi++) {
1678                                                gradientClone[xs][ys] = physicalMap[xs][ys];
1679                                            }
1680                                        }
1681                                    }
1682                                }
1683                            }
1684                            gradientMap = gradientClone;
1685                            return;
1686                        }
1687                    }
1688                }
1689            }
1690        }
1691        if (impassable != null && !impassable.isEmpty()) {
1692            for (Coord pt : impassable) {
1693                if(pt != null && pt.isWithin(width, height)) {
1694                    for (int xs = pt.x, xi = 0; xi < size && xs >= 0; xs--, xi++) {
1695                        for (int ys = pt.y, yi = 0; yi < size && ys >= 0; ys--, yi++) {
1696                            gradientClone[xs][ys] = physicalMap[xs][ys];
1697                        }
1698                    }
1699                }
1700            }
1701        }
1702        gradientMap = gradientClone;
1703    }
1704
1705    /**
1706     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1707     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to the closest reachable
1708     * goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length, which represents movement in a system where
1709     * a single move can be multiple cells if length is greater than 1 and should usually be 1 in standard roguelikes;
1710     * if moving the full length of the list would place the mover in a position shared  by one of the positions in
1711     * onlyPassable (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-cell-movement
1712     * scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell. The keys in impassable should
1713     * be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved  through, and will be ignored if there is a goal
1714     * overlapping one. This overload always scans the whole map; use
1715     * {@link #findPath(int, int, Collection, Collection, Coord, Coord...)} to scan a smaller area for performance reasons.
1716     * <br>
1717     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
1718     * each call to a pathfinding method.
1719     * @param length       the length of the path to calculate
1720     * @param impassable   a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
1721     * @param onlyPassable a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
1722     * @param start        the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
1723     * @param targets      a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
1724     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
1725     */
1726    public ArrayList<Coord> findPath(int length, Collection<Coord> impassable,
1727                                     Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
1728        return findPath(length, -1, impassable, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1729    }
1730
1731    /**
1732     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan or DijkstraMap.partialScan with the listed goals and start
1733     * point, and returns a list of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer
1734     * to the closest reachable goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length, which represents
1735     * movement in a system where a single move can be multiple cells if length is greater than 1 and should usually
1736     * be 1 in standard roguelikes; if moving the full length of the list would place the mover in a position shared
1737     * by one of the positions in onlyPassable (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed
1738     * through in multi-cell-movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1739     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1740     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1741     * The full map will only be scanned if scanLimit is 0 or less; for positive scanLimit values this will scan only
1742     * that distance out from each goal, which can save processing time on maps where only a small part matters.
1743     * Generally, scanLimit should be significantly greater than length.
1744     * <br>
1745     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
1746     * each call to a pathfinding method.
1747     *
1748     * @param length       the length of the path to calculate
1749     * @param scanLimit    how many cells away from a goal to actually process; negative to process whole map
1750     * @param impassable   a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
1751     * @param onlyPassable a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
1752     * @param start        the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
1753     * @param targets      a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
1754     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
1755     */
1756    public ArrayList<Coord> findPath(int length, int scanLimit, Collection<Coord> impassable,
1757                                     Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
1758        return findPath(null, length, scanLimit, impassable, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1759    }
1760    /**
1761     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan or DijkstraMap.partialScan with the listed goals and start
1762     * point, and returns a list of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer
1763     * to the closest reachable goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length, which represents
1764     * movement in a system where a single move can be multiple cells if length is greater than 1 and should usually
1765     * be 1 in standard roguelikes; if moving the full length of the list would place the mover in a position shared
1766     * by one of the positions in onlyPassable (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed
1767     * through in multi-cell-movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1768     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1769     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1770     * The full map will only be scanned if scanLimit is 0 or less; for positive scanLimit values this will scan only
1771     * that distance out from each goal, which can save processing time on maps where only a small part matters.
1772     * Generally, scanLimit should be significantly greater than length.
1773     * <br>
1774     * This overload takes a buffer parameter, an ArrayList of Coord, that the results will be appended to. If the
1775     * buffer is null, a new ArrayList will be made and appended to. This caches its result in a member field, path,
1776     * which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with each call to a pathfinding method. Any existing
1777     * contents of buffer will not affect the path field of this DijkstraMap.
1778     *
1779     * @param buffer       an existing ArrayList of Coord that will have the result appended to it (in-place); if null, this will make a new ArrayList
1780     * @param length       the length of the path to calculate
1781     * @param scanLimit    how many cells away from a goal to actually process; negative to process whole map
1782     * @param impassable   a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
1783     * @param onlyPassable a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
1784     * @param start        the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
1785     * @param targets      a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
1786     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
1787     */
1788    public ArrayList<Coord> findPath(ArrayList<Coord> buffer, int length, int scanLimit, Collection<Coord> impassable,
1789                                     Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
1790        path.clear();
1791        if (!initialized || length <= 0)
1792        {
1793            cutShort = true;
1794            if(buffer == null)
1795                return new ArrayList<>();
1796            else
1797            {
1798                return buffer;
1799            }
1800        }
1801        if (impassable == null)
1802            impassable2.clear();
1803        else
1804        {
1805            impassable2.clear();
1806            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
1807        }
1808        if (onlyPassable != null && length == 1) 
1809            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
1810        
1811        resetMap();
1812        setGoals(targets);
1813        if (goals.isEmpty())
1814        {
1815            cutShort = true;
1816            if(buffer == null)
1817                return new ArrayList<>();
1818            else
1819            {
1820                return buffer;
1821            }
1822        }
1823        if(scanLimit <= 0 || scanLimit < length)
1824            scan(start, impassable2);
1825        else
1826            partialScan(start, scanLimit, impassable2);
1827        Coord currentPos = start;
1828        double paidLength = 0.0;
1829        while (true) {
1830            if (frustration > 500) {
1831                path.clear();
1832                break;
1833            }
1834            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
1835            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
1836            int choice = 0;
1837
1838            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
1839                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
1840                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
1841                    continue;
1842                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
1843                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
1844                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
1845                        choice = d;
1846                    }
1847                }
1848            }
1849
1850            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
1851                cutShort = true;
1852                frustration = 0;
1853                if(buffer == null)
1854                    return new ArrayList<>(path);
1855                else
1856                {
1857                    buffer.addAll(path);
1858                    return buffer;
1859                }
1860            }
1861            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
1862            path.add(currentPos);
1863            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
1864            frustration++;
1865            if (paidLength > length - 1.0) {
1866                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
1867                    tempSet.clear();
1868                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
1869                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
1870                    return findPath(buffer, length, scanLimit, tempSet, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1871                }
1872                break;
1873            }
1874            if (gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
1875                break;
1876        }
1877        cutShort = false;
1878        frustration = 0;
1879        goals.clear();
1880        if(buffer == null)
1881            return new ArrayList<>(path);
1882        else
1883        {
1884            buffer.addAll(path);
1885            return buffer;
1886        }
1887    }
1888
1889    /**
1890     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1891     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until preferredRange is
1892     * reached, or further from a goal if the preferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1893     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1894     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1895     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1896     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1897     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1898     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1899     * <br>
1900     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
1901     * each call to a pathfinding method.
1902     *
1903     * @param moveLength     the length of the path to calculate
1904     * @param preferredRange the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
1905     * @param los            a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1906     *                       should be disregarded.
1907     * @param impassable     a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
1908     * @param onlyPassable   a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
1909     * @param start          the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
1910     * @param targets        a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
1911     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
1912     */
1913    public ArrayList<Coord> findAttackPath(int moveLength, int preferredRange, LOS los, Collection<Coord> impassable,
1914                                           Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
1915        return findAttackPath(moveLength, preferredRange, preferredRange, los, impassable, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1916    }
1917
1918    /**
1919     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1920     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
1921     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
1922     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1923     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1924     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1925     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1926     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
1927     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1928     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1929     * <br>
1930     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
1931     * each call to a pathfinding method.
1932     *
1933     * @param moveLength        the length of the path to calculate
1934     * @param minPreferredRange the (inclusive) lower bound of the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
1935     * @param maxPreferredRange the (inclusive) upper bound of the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
1936     * @param los               a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1937     *                          should be disregarded.
1938     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
1939     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
1940     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
1941     * @param targets           a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
1942     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
1943     */
1944    public ArrayList<Coord> findAttackPath(int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
1945                                           Collection<Coord> impassable, Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
1946        return findAttackPath(null, moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, impassable, onlyPassable, start, targets);
1947    }
1948    /**
1949     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
1950     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
1951     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
1952     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
1953     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
1954     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
1955     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
1956     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell. In most roguelikes where
1957     * movement happens one cell at a time, moveLength should be 1; if it is higher then the path will prefer getting
1958     * further away from the target (using up most or all of moveLength) while minPreferredRange and maxPreferredRange
1959     * can be satisfied. This does ensure a pathfinder with a ranged weapon stays far from melee range, but it may not
1960     * be the expected behavior because it will try to find the best path rather than the shortest it can attack from.
1961     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
1962     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
1963     * <br>
1964     * This overload takes a buffer parameter, an ArrayList of Coord, that the results will be appended to. If the
1965     * buffer is null, a new ArrayList will be made and appended to. This caches its result in a member field, path,
1966     * which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with each call to a pathfinding method. Any existing
1967     * contents of buffer will not affect the path field of this DijkstraMap.
1968     *
1969     * @param buffer            an existing ArrayList of Coord that will have the result appended to it (in-place); if null, this will make a new ArrayList
1970     * @param moveLength        the length of the path to calculate; almost always, the pathfinder will try to use this length in full to obtain the best range
1971     * @param minPreferredRange the (inclusive) lower bound of the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
1972     * @param maxPreferredRange the (inclusive) upper bound of the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
1973     * @param los               a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
1974     *                          should be disregarded.
1975     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
1976     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
1977     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
1978     * @param targets           a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
1979     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
1980     */
1981    public ArrayList<Coord> findAttackPath(ArrayList<Coord> buffer, int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
1982                                           Collection<Coord> impassable, Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
1983        if (!initialized || moveLength <= 0)
1984        {
1985            cutShort = true;
1986            if(buffer == null)
1987                return new ArrayList<>();
1988            else
1989            {
1990                return buffer;
1991            }
1992        }
1993        if (minPreferredRange < 0) minPreferredRange = 0;
1994        if (maxPreferredRange < minPreferredRange) maxPreferredRange = minPreferredRange;
1995        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
1996        if (los != null) {
1997            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
1998                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
1999                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
2000                }
2001            }
2002        }
2003        path.clear();
2004        if (impassable == null)
2005            impassable2.clear();
2006        else
2007        {
2008            impassable2.clear();
2009            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
2010        }
2011        if (onlyPassable != null && moveLength == 1)
2012            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
2013
2014        resetMap();
2015        for (Coord goal : targets) {
2016            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
2017        }
2018        if (goals.isEmpty())
2019        {
2020            cutShort = true;
2021            if(buffer == null)
2022                return new ArrayList<>();
2023            else
2024            {
2025                return buffer;
2026            }
2027        }
2028
2029        Measurement mess = measurement;
2030        if (measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN) {
2031            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
2032        }
2033        scan(null, impassable2);
2034        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2035            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2036                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
2037                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
2038                }
2039            }
2040        }
2041        goals.clear();
2042
2043        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2044            CELL:
2045            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2046                if (gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
2047                    continue;
2048                if (gradientMap[x][y] >= minPreferredRange && gradientMap[x][y] <= maxPreferredRange) {
2049
2050                    for (Coord goal : targets) {
2051                        if (los == null || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)) {
2052                            setGoal(x, y);
2053                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
2054                            continue CELL;
2055                        }
2056                    }
2057                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
2058                } else
2059                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
2060            }
2061        }
2062        measurement = mess;
2063        scan(null, impassable2);
2064        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2065            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2066                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
2067                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
2068                }
2069            }
2070        }
2071        if(gradientMap[start.x][start.y] <= 0.0)
2072        {
2073            cutShort = false;
2074            frustration = 0;
2075            goals.clear();
2076            if(buffer == null)
2077                return new ArrayList<>(path);
2078            else
2079            {
2080                buffer.addAll(path);
2081                return buffer;
2082            }
2083
2084        }
2085        Coord currentPos = start;
2086        double paidLength = 0.0;
2087        while (true) {
2088            if (frustration > 500) {
2089                path.clear();
2090                break;
2091            }
2092            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2093            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
2094            int choice = 0;
2095
2096            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
2097                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
2098                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
2099                    continue;
2100                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best  && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
2101                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
2102                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
2103                        choice = d;
2104                    }
2105                }
2106            }
2107
2108            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
2109                cutShort = true;
2110                frustration = 0;
2111                if(buffer == null)
2112                    return new ArrayList<>(path);
2113                else
2114                {
2115                    buffer.addAll(path);
2116                    return buffer;
2117                }
2118            }
2119            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
2120            path.add(Coord.get(currentPos.x, currentPos.y));
2121            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2122            frustration++;
2123            if (paidLength > moveLength - 1.0) {
2124
2125                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
2126                    tempSet.clear();
2127                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
2128                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
2129                    return findAttackPath(buffer, moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, tempSet,
2130                            onlyPassable, start, targets);
2131                }
2132                break;
2133            }
2134            if (gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
2135                break;
2136        }
2137        cutShort = false;
2138        frustration = 0;
2139        goals.clear();
2140        if(buffer == null)
2141            return new ArrayList<>(path);
2142        else
2143        {
2144            buffer.addAll(path);
2145            return buffer;
2146        }
2147    }
2148
2149    /**
2150     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
2151     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, where goals are
2152     * considered valid if they are at a valid range for the given Technique to hit at least one target
2153     * and ideal if that Technique can affect as many targets as possible from a cell that can be moved
2154     * to with at most movelength steps.
2155     * <br>
2156     * The return value of this method is the path to get to a location to attack, but on its own it
2157     * does not tell the user how to perform the attack.  It does set the targetMap 2D Coord array field
2158     * so that if your position at the end of the returned path is non-null in targetMap, it will be
2159     * a Coord that can be used as a target position for Technique.apply() . If your position at the end
2160     * of the returned path is null, then an ideal attack position was not reachable by the path.
2161     * <br>
2162     * This needs a char[][] dungeon as an argument because DijkstraMap does not always have a char[][]
2163     * version of the map available to it, and certain AOE implementations that a Technique uses may
2164     * need a char[][] specifically to determine what they affect.
2165     * <br>
2166     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
2167     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in allies
2168     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
2169     * movement scenarios, and is also used considered an undesirable thing to affect for the Technique),
2170     * it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
2171     * <br>
2172     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2173     * through, and will be ignored if there is a target overlapping one.
2174     * <br>
2175     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
2176     * each call to a pathfinding method.
2177     *
2178     * @param moveLength the maximum distance to try to pathfind out to; if a spot to use a Technique can be found
2179     *                   while moving no more than this distance, then the targetMap field in this object will have a
2180     *                   target Coord that is ideal for the given Technique at the x, y indices corresponding to the
2181     *                   last Coord in the returned path.
2182     * @param tech       a Technique that we will try to find an ideal place to use, and/or a path toward that place.
2183     * @param dungeon    a char 2D array with '#' for walls.
2184     * @param los        a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferred range should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
2185     *                   should be disregarded.
2186     * @param impassable locations of enemies or mobile hazards/obstacles that aren't in the map as walls
2187     * @param allies     called onlyPassable in other methods, here it also represents allies for Technique things
2188     * @param start      the Coord the pathfinder starts at.
2189     * @param targets    a Set of Coord, not an array of Coord or variable argument list as in other methods.
2190     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that represents a path to travel to get to an ideal place to use tech. Copy of path.
2191     */
2192    public ArrayList<Coord> findTechniquePath(int moveLength, Technique tech, char[][] dungeon, LOS los,
2193                                              Collection<Coord> impassable, Collection<Coord> allies, Coord start, Collection<Coord> targets) {
2194        return findTechniquePath(null, moveLength, tech, dungeon, los, impassable, allies, start, targets);
2195    }
2196    /**
2197     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
2198     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, where goals are
2199     * considered valid if they are at a valid range for the given Technique to hit at least one target
2200     * and ideal if that Technique can affect as many targets as possible from a cell that can be moved
2201     * to with at most movelength steps.
2202     * <br>
2203     * The return value of this method is the path to get to a location to attack, but on its own it
2204     * does not tell the user how to perform the attack.  It does set the targetMap 2D Coord array field
2205     * so that if your position at the end of the returned path is non-null in targetMap, it will be
2206     * a Coord that can be used as a target position for Technique.apply() . If your position at the end
2207     * of the returned path is null, then an ideal attack position was not reachable by the path.
2208     * <br>
2209     * This needs a char[][] dungeon as an argument because DijkstraMap does not always have a char[][]
2210     * version of the map available to it, and certain AOE implementations that a Technique uses may
2211     * need a char[][] specifically to determine what they affect.
2212     * <br>
2213     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
2214     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in allies
2215     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
2216     * movement scenarios, and is also used considered an undesirable thing to affect for the Technique),
2217     * it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
2218     * <br>
2219     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2220     * through, and will be ignored if there is a target overlapping one.
2221     * <br>
2222     * This overload takes a buffer parameter, an ArrayList of Coord, that the results will be appended to. If the
2223     * buffer is null, a new ArrayList will be made and appended to. This caches its result in a member field, path,
2224     * which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with each call to a pathfinding method. Any existing
2225     * contents of buffer will not affect the path field of this DijkstraMap.
2226     *
2227     * @param buffer     an existing ArrayList of Coord that will have the result appended to it (in-place); if null, this will make a new ArrayList
2228     * @param moveLength the maximum distance to try to pathfind out to; if a spot to use a Technique can be found
2229     *                   while moving no more than this distance, then the targetMap field in this object will have a
2230     *                   target Coord that is ideal for the given Technique at the x, y indices corresponding to the
2231     *                   last Coord in the returned path.
2232     * @param tech       a Technique that we will try to find an ideal place to use, and/or a path toward that place.
2233     * @param dungeon    a char 2D array with '#' for walls.
2234     * @param los        a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferred range should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
2235     *                   should be disregarded.
2236     * @param impassable locations of enemies or mobile hazards/obstacles that aren't in the map as walls
2237     * @param allies     called onlyPassable in other methods, here it also represents allies for Technique things
2238     * @param start      the Coord the pathfinder starts at.
2239     * @param targets    a Set of Coord, not an array of Coord or variable argument list as in other methods.
2240     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that represents a path to travel to get to an ideal place to use tech. Copy of path.
2241     */
2242    public ArrayList<Coord> findTechniquePath(ArrayList<Coord> buffer, int moveLength, Technique tech, char[][] dungeon, LOS los,
2243                                              Collection<Coord> impassable, Collection<Coord> allies, Coord start, Collection<Coord> targets) {
2244        if (!initialized || moveLength <= 0)
2245        {
2246            cutShort = true;
2247            if(buffer == null)
2248                return new ArrayList<>();
2249            else
2250            {
2251                return buffer;
2252            }
2253        }
2254        tech.setMap(dungeon);
2255        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
2256        double[][] worthMap = new double[width][height];
2257        double[][] userDistanceMap;
2258        double paidLength = 0.0;
2259        
2260        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2261            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2262                resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
2263                targetMap[x][y] = null;
2264            }
2265        }
2266
2267        path.clear();
2268        if (targets == null || targets.size() == 0)
2269        {
2270            cutShort = true;
2271            if(buffer == null)
2272                return new ArrayList<>();
2273            else
2274            {
2275                return buffer;
2276            }
2277        }
2278        if (impassable == null)
2279            impassable2.clear();
2280        else {
2281            impassable2.clear();
2282            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
2283        }
2284        if (allies == null)
2285            friends.clear();
2286        else {
2287            friends.clear();
2288            friends.addAll(allies);
2289            friends.remove(start);
2290        }
2291
2292        resetMap();
2293        setGoal(start);
2294        userDistanceMap = scan(impassable2);
2295        clearGoals();
2296        resetMap();
2297        for (Coord goal : targets) {
2298            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
2299        }
2300        if (goals.isEmpty())
2301        {
2302            cutShort = true;
2303            if(buffer == null)
2304                return new ArrayList<>();
2305            else
2306            {
2307                return buffer;
2308            }
2309        }
2310
2311        Measurement mess = measurement;
2312        /*
2313        if(measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN)
2314        {
2315            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
2316        }
2317        */
2318        scan(null, impassable2);
2319        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2320            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2321                if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
2322                    gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
2323                }
2324            }
2325        }
2326
2327        clearGoals();
2328
2329        Coord tempPt;
2330        OrderedMap<Coord, ArrayList<Coord>> ideal;
2331        // generate an array of the single best location to attack when you are in a given cell.
2332        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2333            CELL:
2334            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2335                tempPt = Coord.get(x, y);
2336                if (gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK || userDistanceMap[x][y] > moveLength * 2.0)
2337                    continue;
2338                if (gradientMap[x][y] >= tech.aoe.getMinRange() && gradientMap[x][y] <= tech.aoe.getMaxRange()) {
2339                    for (Coord tgt : targets) {
2340                        if (los == null || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, tgt.x, tgt.y)) {
2341                            ideal = tech.idealLocations(tempPt, targets, friends);
2342                            if (!ideal.isEmpty()) {
2343                                targetMap[x][y] = ideal.keyAt(0);
2344                                worthMap[x][y] = ideal.getAt(0).size();
2345                                setGoal(x, y);
2346                            }
2347                            continue CELL;
2348                        }
2349                    }
2350                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
2351                } else
2352                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
2353            }
2354        }
2355        scan(null,impassable2);
2356
2357        double currentDistance = gradientMap[start.x][start.y];
2358        if (currentDistance <= moveLength) {
2359            int[] g_arr = goals.toArray();
2360
2361            goals.clear();
2362            setGoal(start);
2363            scan(null, impassable2, false);
2364            gradientMap[start.x][start.y] = moveLength;
2365            int decX, decY;
2366            double bestWorth = 0.0;
2367            for (int g, ig = 0; ig < g_arr.length; ig++) {
2368                g = g_arr[ig];
2369                decX = decodeX(g);
2370                decY = decodeY(g);
2371                if (gradientMap[decX][decY] <= moveLength && worthMap[decX][decY] > bestWorth) {
2372                    goals.clear();
2373                    goals.add(g);
2374                    bestWorth = worthMap[decX][decY];
2375                }
2376                else if (gradientMap[decX][decY] <= moveLength && bestWorth > 0 && worthMap[decX][decY] == bestWorth)
2377                {
2378                    goals.add(g);
2379                }
2380            }
2381            resetMap();
2382           /* for(Coord g : goals.keySet())
2383            {
2384                gradientMap[g.x][g.y] = 0.0 - worthMap[g.x][g.y];
2385            }*/
2386            scan(impassable2);
2387
2388        }
2389
2390        measurement = mess;
2391
2392        Coord currentPos = Coord.get(start.x, start.y);
2393        while (true) {
2394            if (frustration > 500) {
2395                path.clear();
2396                break;
2397            }
2398            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2399            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
2400            int choice = 0;
2401
2402            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
2403                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
2404                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
2405                    continue;
2406                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
2407                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
2408                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
2409                        choice = d;
2410                    }
2411                }
2412            }
2413            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y]) {
2414                if (friends.contains(currentPos)) {
2415                    tempSet.clear();
2416                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
2417                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
2418                    return findTechniquePath(buffer, moveLength, tech, dungeon, los, tempSet,
2419                            friends, start, targets);
2420                }
2421                break;
2422            }
2423            if (best > gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
2424                cutShort = true;
2425                frustration = 0;
2426                if(buffer == null)
2427                    return new ArrayList<>(path);
2428                else
2429                {
2430                    buffer.addAll(path);
2431                    return buffer;
2432                }
2433            }
2434            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
2435            path.add(currentPos);
2436            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2437            frustration++;
2438            if (paidLength > moveLength - 1.0) {
2439                if (friends.contains(currentPos)) {
2440                    tempSet.clear();
2441                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
2442                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
2443                    return findTechniquePath(buffer, moveLength, tech, dungeon, los, tempSet,
2444                            friends, start, targets);
2445                }
2446                break;
2447            }
2448//            if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
2449//                break;
2450        }
2451        cutShort = false;
2452        frustration = 0;
2453        goals.clear();
2454        if(buffer == null)
2455            return new ArrayList<>(path);
2456        else
2457        {
2458            buffer.addAll(path);
2459            return buffer;
2460        }
2461    }
2462
2463
2464    private double cachedLongerPaths = 1.2;
2465    private HashSet<Coord> cachedImpassable = new HashSet<>(32, 0.25f);
2466    private Coord[] cachedFearSources;
2467    private double[][] cachedFleeMap;
2468    private int cachedSize = 1;
2469
2470    /**
2471     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed fearSources and start point, and returns a list
2472     * of Coord positions (using Manhattan distance) needed to get further from the closest fearSources, meant
2473     * for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full
2474     * length of the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
2475     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
2476     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
2477     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2478     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
2479     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
2480     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
2481     * The parameters preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
2482     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
2483     * unnecessary scans.
2484     * <br>
2485     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
2486     * each call to a pathfinding method.
2487     *
2488     * @param length            the length of the path to calculate
2489     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
2490     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
2491     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
2492     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
2493     * @param fearSources       a vararg or array of Coord positions to run away from
2494     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes away from fear sources. Copy of path.
2495     */
2496    public ArrayList<Coord> findFleePath(int length, double preferLongerPaths, Collection<Coord> impassable,
2497                                         Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... fearSources) {
2498        return findFleePath(null, length, -1, preferLongerPaths, impassable, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
2499    }
2500
2501    /**
2502     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan or DijkstraMap.partialScan with the listed fearSources and start
2503     * point, and returns a list of Coord positions (using this DijkstraMap's metric) needed to get further from
2504     * the closest fearSources, meant for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length,
2505     * which represents movement in a system where a single move can be multiple cells if length is greater than 1 and
2506     * should usually be 1 in standard roguelikes; if moving the full length of the list would place the mover in a
2507     * position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable (which is typically filled with friendly units that can
2508     * be passed through in multi-cell-movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into
2509     * that cell. The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2510     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
2511     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
2512     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
2513     * The parameters preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
2514     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
2515     * unnecessary scans. However, scanLimit is not cached; if you use scanLimit then it is assumed you are using some
2516     * value for it that shouldn't change relative to the other parameters (like twice the length).
2517     * The full map will only be scanned if scanLimit is 0 or less; for positive scanLimit values this will scan only
2518     * that distance out from each goal, which can save processing time on maps where only a small part matters.
2519     * Generally, scanLimit should be significantly greater than length.
2520     * <br>
2521     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
2522     * each call to a pathfinding method.
2523     *
2524     * @param length            the length of the path to calculate
2525     * @param scanLimit         how many steps away from a fear source to calculate; negative scans the whole map
2526     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
2527     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
2528     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
2529     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
2530     * @param fearSources       a vararg or array of Coord positions to run away from
2531     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes away from fear sources. Copy of path.
2532     */
2533    public ArrayList<Coord> findFleePath(int length, int scanLimit, double preferLongerPaths, Collection<Coord> impassable,
2534                                         Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... fearSources) {
2535        return findFleePath(null, length, scanLimit, preferLongerPaths, impassable, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
2536    }
2537    /**
2538     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan or DijkstraMap.partialScan with the listed fearSources and start
2539     * point, and returns a list of Coord positions (using this DijkstraMap's metric) needed to get further from
2540     * the closest fearSources, meant for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length,
2541     * which represents movement in a system where a single move can be multiple cells if length is greater than 1 and
2542     * should usually be 1 in standard roguelikes; if moving the full length of the list would place the mover in a
2543     * position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable (which is typically filled with friendly units that can
2544     * be passed through in multi-cell-movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into
2545     * that cell. The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2546     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
2547     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
2548     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
2549     * The parameters preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
2550     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
2551     * unnecessary scans. However, scanLimit is not cached; if you use scanLimit then it is assumed you are using some
2552     * value for it that shouldn't change relative to the other parameters (like twice the length).
2553     * The full map will only be scanned if scanLimit is 0 or less; for positive scanLimit values this will scan only
2554     * that distance out from each goal, which can save processing time on maps where only a small part matters.
2555     * Generally, scanLimit should be significantly greater than length.
2556     * <br>
2557     * This overload takes a buffer parameter, an ArrayList of Coord, that the results will be appended to. If the
2558     * buffer is null, a new ArrayList will be made and appended to. This caches its result in a member field, path,
2559     * which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with each call to a pathfinding method. Any existing
2560     * contents of buffer will not affect the path field of this DijkstraMap.
2561     *
2562     * @param buffer            an existing ArrayList of Coord that will have the result appended to it (in-place); if null, this will make a new ArrayList
2563     * @param length            the length of the path to calculate
2564     * @param scanLimit         how many steps away from a fear source to calculate; negative scans the whole map
2565     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
2566     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
2567     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
2568     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
2569     * @param fearSources       a vararg or array of Coord positions to run away from
2570     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes away from fear sources. Copy of path.
2571     */
2572    public ArrayList<Coord> findFleePath(ArrayList<Coord> buffer, int length, int scanLimit, double preferLongerPaths, Collection<Coord> impassable,
2573                                         Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... fearSources) {
2574        if (!initialized || length <= 0)
2575        {
2576            cutShort = true;
2577            if(buffer == null)
2578                return new ArrayList<>();
2579            else
2580            {
2581                return buffer;
2582            }
2583        }
2584        path.clear();
2585        if (fearSources == null || fearSources.length < 1) {
2586            cutShort = true;
2587            if(buffer == null)
2588                return new ArrayList<>();
2589            else
2590            {
2591                return buffer;
2592            }
2593        }
2594
2595        if (impassable == null)
2596            impassable2.clear();
2597        else
2598        {
2599            impassable2.clear();
2600            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
2601        }
2602        if(onlyPassable != null && length == 1)
2603            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
2604        if (cachedSize == 1 && preferLongerPaths == cachedLongerPaths && impassable2.equals(cachedImpassable) &&
2605                Arrays.equals(fearSources, cachedFearSources)) {
2606            gradientMap = cachedFleeMap;
2607        } else {
2608            cachedLongerPaths = preferLongerPaths;
2609            cachedImpassable.clear();
2610            cachedImpassable.addAll(impassable2);
2611            cachedFearSources = new Coord[fearSources.length];
2612            System.arraycopy(fearSources, 0, cachedFearSources, 0, fearSources.length);
2613            cachedSize = 1;
2614            resetMap();
2615            setGoals(fearSources);
2616            if (goals.isEmpty())
2617            {
2618                cutShort = true;
2619                if(buffer == null)
2620                    return new ArrayList<>();
2621                else
2622                {
2623                    return buffer;
2624                }
2625            }
2626
2627            if(scanLimit <= 0 || scanLimit < length)
2628                cachedFleeMap = scan(impassable2);
2629            else
2630                cachedFleeMap = partialScan(scanLimit, impassable2);
2631
2632
2633            for (int x = 0; x < gradientMap.length; x++) {
2634                for (int y = 0; y < gradientMap[x].length; y++) {
2635                    gradientMap[x][y] *= (gradientMap[x][y] >= FLOOR) ? 1.0 : -preferLongerPaths;
2636                }
2637            }
2638
2639            if(scanLimit <= 0 || scanLimit < length)
2640            {
2641                scan(null, impassable2, true);
2642                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2643                    for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2644                        if (gradientMap[x][y] == FLOOR) {
2645                            gradientMap[x][y] = DARK;
2646                        }
2647                    }
2648                    System.arraycopy(gradientMap[x], 0, cachedFleeMap[x], 0, height);
2649                }
2650            }
2651            else
2652                cachedFleeMap = partialScan(scanLimit, impassable2);
2653        }
2654        Coord currentPos = start;
2655        double paidLength = 0.0;
2656        while (true) {
2657            if (frustration > 500) {
2658                path.clear();
2659                break;
2660            }
2661            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2662            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
2663            int choice = 0;
2664
2665            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
2666                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
2667                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
2668                    continue;
2669                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
2670                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
2671                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
2672                        choice = d;
2673                    }
2674                }
2675            }
2676            if (best >= gradientMap[start.x][start.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
2677                cutShort = true;
2678                frustration = 0;
2679                if(buffer == null)
2680                    return new ArrayList<>(path);
2681                else
2682                {
2683                    buffer.addAll(path);
2684                    return buffer;
2685                }
2686            }
2687            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
2688            if (path.size() > 0) {
2689                Coord last = path.get(path.size() - 1);
2690                if (gradientMap[last.x][last.y] <= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
2691                    break;
2692            }
2693            path.add(currentPos);
2694            frustration++;
2695            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2696            if (paidLength > length - 1.0) {
2697                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
2698                    tempSet.clear();
2699                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
2700                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
2701                    return findFleePath(buffer, length, scanLimit, preferLongerPaths, tempSet, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
2702                }
2703                break;
2704            }
2705        }
2706        cutShort = false;
2707        frustration = 0;
2708        goals.clear();
2709        if(buffer == null) 
2710            return new ArrayList<>(path);
2711        else
2712        {
2713            buffer.addAll(path);
2714            return buffer;
2715        }
2716    }
2717
2718    /**
2719     * For pathfinding creatures larger than 1x1 cell; scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals
2720     * and start point, and returns a list
2721     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to the closest reachable
2722     * goal. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full length of
2723     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
2724     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
2725     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
2726     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2727     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
2728     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
2729     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
2730     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
2731     * <br>
2732     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
2733     * each call to a pathfinding method.
2734     *
2735     * @param size         the side length of the creature trying to find a path
2736     * @param length       the length of the path to calculate
2737     * @param impassable   a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
2738     * @param onlyPassable a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
2739     * @param start        the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
2740     * @param targets      a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
2741     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the min-x, min-y locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
2742     */
2743
2744    public ArrayList<Coord> findPathLarge(final int size, int length, Collection<Coord> impassable,
2745                                          Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
2746        return findPathLarge(size, length, -1, impassable, onlyPassable, start, targets);
2747    }
2748    public ArrayList<Coord> findPathLarge(final int size, int length, final int scanLimit, Collection<Coord> impassable,
2749                                          Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
2750
2751        if (!initialized) return null;
2752        path.clear();
2753        if (impassable == null)
2754            impassable2.clear();
2755        else
2756        {
2757            impassable2.clear();
2758            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
2759        }
2760        if(onlyPassable != null && length == 1)
2761            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
2762
2763        resetMap();
2764        for (Coord goal : targets) {
2765            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
2766        }
2767        if (goals.isEmpty())
2768        {
2769            cutShort = true;
2770            return new ArrayList<>(path);
2771        }
2772
2773        if(length < 0)
2774            length = 0;
2775        if(scanLimit <= 0 || scanLimit < length)
2776            scan(start, impassable2, size);
2777        else
2778            partialScan(scanLimit, start, impassable2, size);
2779
2780        Coord currentPos = start;
2781        double paidLength = 0.0;
2782        while (true) {
2783            if (frustration > 500) {
2784                path.clear();
2785                break;
2786            }
2787            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2788            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
2789            int choice = 0;
2790
2791            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
2792                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
2793                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
2794                    continue;
2795                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
2796                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
2797                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
2798                        choice = d;
2799                    }
2800                }
2801            }
2802
2803            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
2804                cutShort = true;
2805                frustration = 0;
2806                return new ArrayList<>(path);
2807            }
2808            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
2809
2810            path.add(currentPos);
2811            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2812            frustration++;
2813            if (paidLength > length - 1.0) {
2814                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
2815                    tempSet.clear();
2816                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
2817                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
2818                    return findPathLarge(size, length, tempSet, onlyPassable, start, targets);
2819                }
2820                break;
2821            }
2822            if (gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
2823                break;
2824        }
2825        cutShort = false;
2826        frustration = 0;
2827        goals.clear();
2828        return new ArrayList<>(path);
2829    }
2830
2831    /**
2832     * For pathfinding creatures larger than 1x1 cell; scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals
2833     * and start point, and returns a list
2834     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until preferredRange is
2835     * reached, or further from a goal if the preferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
2836     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
2837     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
2838     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
2839     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
2840     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2841     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
2842     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
2843     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
2844     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
2845     * <br>
2846     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
2847     * each call to a pathfinding method.
2848     *
2849     * @param size           the side length of the creature trying to find a path
2850     * @param moveLength     the length of the path to calculate
2851     * @param preferredRange the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
2852     * @param los            a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
2853     *                       should be disregarded.
2854     * @param impassable     a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
2855     * @param onlyPassable   a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
2856     * @param start          the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
2857     * @param targets        a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
