2858     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the min-x, min-y locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
2859     */
2860    public ArrayList<Coord> findAttackPathLarge(int size, int moveLength, int preferredRange, LOS los, Collection<Coord> impassable,
2861                                                Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
2862        if (!initialized) return null;
2863        if (preferredRange < 0) preferredRange = 0;
2864        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
2865        if (los != null) {
2866            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2867                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2868                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
2869                }
2870            }
2871        }
2872        path.clear();
2873        if (impassable == null)
2874            impassable2.clear();
2875        else
2876        {
2877            impassable2.clear();
2878            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
2879        }
2880        if(onlyPassable != null && moveLength == 1)
2881            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
2882
2883        resetMap();
2884        for (Coord goal : targets) {
2885            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
2886        }
2887        if (goals.isEmpty())
2888        {
2889            cutShort = true;
2890            return new ArrayList<>(path);
2891        }
2892
2893        Measurement mess = measurement;
2894        if (measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN) {
2895            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
2896        }
2897        scan(impassable2, size);
2898        goals.clear();
2899
2900        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2901            CELL:
2902            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2903                if (gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
2904                    continue;
2905                if (x + 2 < width && y + 2 < height && gradientMap[x][y] == preferredRange) {
2906                    for (Coord goal : targets) {
2907                        if (los == null
2908                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)
2909                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x + 1, y, goal.x, goal.y)
2910                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y + 1, goal.x, goal.y)
2911                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x + 1, y + 1, goal.x, goal.y)) {
2912                            setGoal(x, y);
2913                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
2914                            continue CELL;
2915                        }
2916                    }
2917                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
2918                } else
2919                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
2920            }
2921        }
2922        measurement = mess;
2923        scan(impassable2, size);
2924
2925        Coord currentPos = start;
2926        double paidLength = 0.0;
2927        while (true) {
2928            if (frustration > 500) {
2929                path.clear();
2930                break;
2931            }
2932            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2933            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
2934            int choice = 0;
2935
2936            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
2937                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
2938                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
2939                    continue;
2940                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
2941                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
2942                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
2943                        choice = d;
2944                    }
2945                }
2946            }
2947
2948            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
2949                cutShort = true;
2950                frustration = 0;
2951                return new ArrayList<>(path);
2952            }
2953            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
2954            path.add(currentPos);
2955            frustration++;
2956            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
2957            if (paidLength > moveLength - 1.0) {
2958                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
2959                    tempSet.clear();
2960                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
2961                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
2962                    return findAttackPathLarge(size, moveLength, preferredRange, los, tempSet, onlyPassable, start, targets);
2963                }
2964                break;
2965            }
2966            if (gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
2967                break;
2968        }
2969        cutShort = false;
2970        frustration = 0;
2971        goals.clear();
2972        return new ArrayList<>(path);
2973    }
2974
2975    /**
2976     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed goals and start point, and returns a list
2977     * of Coord positions (using the current measurement) needed to get closer to a goal, until a cell is reached with
2978     * a distance from a goal that is at least equal to minPreferredRange and no more than maxPreferredRange,
2979     * which may go further from a goal if the minPreferredRange has not been met at the current distance.
2980     * The maximum length of the returned list is given by moveLength; if moving the full length of
2981     * the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
2982     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
2983     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
2984     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
2985     * through, and will be ignored if there is a goal overlapping one.
2986     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
2987     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
2988     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
2989     * <br>
2990     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
2991     * each call to a pathfinding method.
2992     *
2993     * @param size              the side length of the creature trying to find a path
2994     * @param moveLength        the length of the path to calculate
2995     * @param minPreferredRange the (inclusive) lower bound of the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
2996     * @param maxPreferredRange the (inclusive) upper bound of the distance this unit will try to keep from a target
2997     * @param los               a squidgrid.LOS object if the preferredRange should try to stay in line of sight, or null if LoS
2998     *                          should be disregarded.
2999     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
3000     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
3001     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
3002     * @param targets           a vararg or array of Coord that this will try to pathfind toward
3003     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the min-x, min-y locations of this creature as it goes toward a target. Copy of path.
3004     */
3005    public ArrayList<Coord> findAttackPathLarge(int size, int moveLength, int minPreferredRange, int maxPreferredRange, LOS los,
3006                                                Collection<Coord> impassable, Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... targets) {
3007        if (!initialized) return null;
3008        if (minPreferredRange < 0) minPreferredRange = 0;
3009        if (maxPreferredRange < minPreferredRange) maxPreferredRange = minPreferredRange;
3010        double[][] resMap = new double[width][height];
3011        if (los != null) {
3012            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3013                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3014                    resMap[x][y] = (physicalMap[x][y] == WALL) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
3015                }
3016            }
3017        }
3018        path.clear();
3019        if (impassable == null)
3020            impassable2.clear();
3021        else
3022        {
3023            impassable2.clear();
3024            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
3025        }
3026        if(onlyPassable != null && moveLength == 1)
3027            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
3028
3029        resetMap();
3030        for (Coord goal : targets) {
3031            setGoal(goal);
3032        }
3033        if (goals.isEmpty())
3034        {
3035            cutShort = true;
3036            return new ArrayList<>(path);
3037        }
3038
3039        Measurement mess = measurement;
3040        if (measurement == Measurement.EUCLIDEAN) {
3041            measurement = Measurement.CHEBYSHEV;
3042        }
3043        scan(impassable2, size);
3044        goals.clear();
3045
3046        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3047            CELL:
3048            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3049                if (gradientMap[x][y] == WALL || gradientMap[x][y] == DARK)
3050                    continue;
3051                if (x + 2 < width && y + 2 < height && gradientMap[x][y] >= minPreferredRange && gradientMap[x][y] <= maxPreferredRange) {
3052                    for (Coord goal : targets) {
3053                        if (los == null
3054                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y, goal.x, goal.y)
3055                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x + 1, y, goal.x, goal.y)
3056                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x, y + 1, goal.x, goal.y)
3057                                || los.isReachable(resMap, x + 1, y + 1, goal.x, goal.y)) {
3058                            setGoal(x, y);
3059                            gradientMap[x][y] = 0;
3060                            continue CELL;
3061                        }
3062                    }
3063                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
3064                } else
3065                    gradientMap[x][y] = FLOOR;
3066            }
3067        }
3068        measurement = mess;
3069        scan(impassable2, size);
3070
3071        Coord currentPos = start;
3072        double paidLength = 0.0;
3073        while (true) {
3074            if (frustration > 500) {
3075                path.clear();
3076                break;
3077            }
3078
3079            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
3080            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
3081            int choice = 0;
3082
3083            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
3084                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
3085                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
3086                    continue;
3087                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
3088                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
3089                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
3090                        choice = d;
3091                    }
3092                }
3093            }
3094            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
3095                cutShort = true;
3096                frustration = 0;
3097                return new ArrayList<>(path);
3098            }
3099            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
3100
3101            path.add(currentPos);
3102            frustration++;
3103            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
3104            if (paidLength > moveLength - 1.0) {
3105                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
3106                    tempSet.clear();
3107                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
3108                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
3109                    return findAttackPathLarge(size, moveLength, minPreferredRange, maxPreferredRange, los, tempSet,
3110                            onlyPassable, start, targets);
3111                }
3112                break;
3113            }
3114            if (gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
3115                break;
3116        }
3117        cutShort = false;
3118        frustration = 0;
3119        goals.clear();
3120        return new ArrayList<>(path);
3121    }
3122
3123    /**
3124     * Scans the dungeon using DijkstraMap.scan with the listed fearSources and start point, and returns a list
3125     * of Coord positions (using Manhattan distance) needed to get further from the closest fearSources, meant
3126     * for running away. The maximum length of the returned list is given by length; if moving the full
3127     * length of the list would place the mover in a position shared by one of the positions in onlyPassable
3128     * (which is typically filled with friendly units that can be passed through in multi-tile-
3129     * movement scenarios), it will recalculate a move so that it does not pass into that cell.
3130     * The keys in impassable should be the positions of enemies and obstacles that cannot be moved
3131     * through, and will be ignored if there is a fearSource overlapping one. The preferLongerPaths parameter
3132     * is meant to be tweaked and adjusted; higher values should make creatures prefer to escape out of
3133     * doorways instead of hiding in the closest corner, and a value of 1.2 should be typical for many maps.
3134     * The parameters size, preferLongerPaths, impassable, and the varargs used for fearSources will be cached, and
3135     * any subsequent calls that use the same values as the last values passed will avoid recalculating
3136     * unnecessary scans. Calls to findFleePath will cache as if size is 1, and may share a cache with this function.
3137     * The parameter size refers to the side length of a square unit, such as 2 for a 2x2 unit. The
3138     * parameter start must refer to the minimum-x, minimum-y cell of that unit if size is &gt; 1, and
3139     * all positions in the returned path will refer to movement of the minimum-x, minimum-y cell.
3140     * <br>
3141     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
3142     * each call to a pathfinding method.
3143     *
3144     * @param size              the side length of the creature trying the find a path
3145     * @param length            the length of the path to calculate
3146     * @param preferLongerPaths Set this to 1.2 if you aren't sure; it will probably need tweaking for different maps.
3147     * @param impassable        a Set of impassable Coord positions that may change (not constant like walls); can be null
3148     * @param onlyPassable      a Set of Coord positions that this pathfinder cannot end a path occupying (typically allies); can be null
3149     * @param start             the start of the path, should correspond to the minimum-x, minimum-y position of the pathfinder
3150     * @param fearSources       a vararg or array of Coord positions to run away from
3151     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that will contain the locations of this creature as it goes away from fear sources. Copy of path.
3152     */
3153    public ArrayList<Coord> findFleePathLarge(int size, int length, double preferLongerPaths, Collection<Coord> impassable,
3154                                              Collection<Coord> onlyPassable, Coord start, Coord... fearSources) {
3155        if (!initialized) return null;
3156        path.clear();
3157        if (impassable == null)
3158            impassable2.clear();
3159        else {
3160            impassable2.clear();
3161            impassable2.addAll(impassable);
3162        }
3163        if(onlyPassable != null && length == 1)
3164            impassable2.addAll(onlyPassable);
3165        if (fearSources == null || fearSources.length < 1) {
3166            cutShort = true;
3167            return new ArrayList<>(path);
3168        }
3169        if (size == cachedSize && preferLongerPaths == cachedLongerPaths && impassable2.equals(cachedImpassable)
3170                && Arrays.equals(fearSources, cachedFearSources)) {
3171            gradientMap = cachedFleeMap;
3172        } else {
3173            cachedLongerPaths = preferLongerPaths;
3174            cachedImpassable.clear();
3175            cachedImpassable.addAll(impassable2);
3176            cachedFearSources = new Coord[fearSources.length];
3177            System.arraycopy(fearSources, 0, cachedFearSources, 0, fearSources.length);
3178            cachedSize = size;
3179            resetMap();
3180            setGoals(fearSources);
3181            if (goals.isEmpty())
3182            {
3183                cutShort = true;
3184                return new ArrayList<>(path);
3185            }
3186
3187            scan(impassable2, size);
3188
3189            for (int x = 0; x < gradientMap.length; x++) {
3190                for (int y = 0; y < gradientMap[x].length; y++) {
3191                    gradientMap[x][y] *= (gradientMap[x][y] >= FLOOR) ? 1.0 : (0.0 - preferLongerPaths);
3192                }
3193            }
3194            cachedFleeMap = scan(impassable2, size);
3195        }
3196        Coord currentPos = start;
3197        double paidLength = 0.0;
3198        while (true) {
3199            if (frustration > 500) {
3200                path.clear();
3201                break;
3202            }
3203
3204            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
3205            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
3206            int choice = 0;
3207
3208            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
3209                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
3210                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
3211                    continue;
3212                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best && !impassable2.contains(pt)) {
3213                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
3214                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
3215                        choice = d;
3216                    }
3217                }
3218            }
3219            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
3220                cutShort = true;
3221                frustration = 0;
3222                return new ArrayList<>(path);
3223            }
3224            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
3225
3226            if (path.size() > 0) {
3227                Coord last = path.get(path.size() - 1);
3228                if (gradientMap[last.x][last.y] <= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y])
3229                    break;
3230            }
3231            path.add(currentPos);
3232            frustration++;
3233            paidLength += costMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
3234            if (paidLength > length - 1.0) {
3235                if (onlyPassable != null && onlyPassable.contains(currentPos)) {
3236                    tempSet.clear();
3237                    tempSet.addAll(impassable2);
3238                    tempSet.add(currentPos);
3239                    return findFleePathLarge(size, length, preferLongerPaths, tempSet, onlyPassable, start, fearSources);
3240                }
3241                break;
3242            }
3243        }
3244        cutShort = false;
3245        frustration = 0;
3246        goals.clear();
3247        return new ArrayList<>(path);
3248    }
3249
3250
3251    /**
3252     * When you can control how often the (relatively time-intensive) scan() method is called, but may need simple paths
3253     * very frequently (such as for a path that follows the mouse), you can use this method to reduce the amount of work
3254     * needed to find paths. Needs scan() or partialScan() to already be called and at least one goal to already be set,
3255     * and does not restrict the length of the path or behave as if the pathfinder has allies or enemies.
3256     * <br>
3257     * This caches its result in a member field, path, which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with
3258     * each call to a pathfinding method.
3259     *
3260     * @param target the target cell
3261     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that make up the best path. Copy of path.
3262     */
3263    public ArrayList<Coord> findPathPreScanned(Coord target) {
3264        return findPathPreScanned(null, target);
3265    }
3266    /**
3267     * When you can control how often the (relatively time-intensive) scan() method is called, but may need simple paths
3268     * very frequently (such as for a path that follows the mouse), you can use this method to reduce the amount of work
3269     * needed to find paths. Needs scan() or partialScan() to already be called and at least one goal to already be set,
3270     * and does not restrict the length of the path or behave as if the pathfinder has allies or enemies.
3271     * <br>
3272     * This overload takes a buffer parameter, an ArrayList of Coord, that the results will be appended to. If the
3273     * buffer is null, a new ArrayList will be made and appended to. This caches its result in a member field, path,
3274     * which can be fetched after finding a path and will change with each call to a pathfinding method. Any existing
3275     * contents of buffer will not affect the path field of this DijkstraMap.
3276     *
3277     * @param buffer an existing ArrayList of Coord that will have the result appended to it (in-place); if null, this will make a new ArrayList
3278     * @param target the target cell
3279     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that make up the best path, appended to buffer (if non-null)
3280     */
3281    public ArrayList<Coord> findPathPreScanned(ArrayList<Coord> buffer, Coord target) {
3282        path.clear();
3283        if (!initialized || goals == null || goals.isEmpty())
3284        {
3285            if(buffer == null)
3286                return new ArrayList<>();
3287            else
3288            {
3289                return buffer;
3290            }
3291        }
3292        Coord currentPos = target;
3293        if(gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] <= FLOOR)
3294            path.add(currentPos);
3295        else
3296        {
3297            if(buffer == null)
3298                return new ArrayList<>();
3299            else
3300            {
3301                return buffer;
3302            }
3303
3304        }
3305        while (true) {
3306            if (frustration > 2000) {
3307                path.clear();
3308                break;
3309            }
3310            double best = gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y];
3311            appendDirToShuffle(rng);
3312            int choice = 0;
3313
3314            for (int d = 0; d <= measurement.directionCount(); d++) {
3315                Coord pt = Coord.get(currentPos.x + dirs[d].deltaX, currentPos.y + dirs[d].deltaY);
3316                if(!pt.isWithin(width, height))
3317                    continue;
3318                if (gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y] < best) {
3319                    if (dirs[choice] == Direction.NONE || !path.contains(pt)) {
3320                        best = gradientMap[pt.x][pt.y];
3321                        choice = d;
3322                    }
3323                }
3324            }
3325
3326            if (best >= gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] || physicalMap[currentPos.x + dirs[choice].deltaX][currentPos.y + dirs[choice].deltaY] > FLOOR) {
3327                cutShort = true;
3328                frustration = 0;
3329                if(buffer == null)
3330                    return new ArrayList<>(path);
3331                else
3332                {
3333                    buffer.addAll(path);
3334                    return buffer;
3335                }
3336            }
3337            currentPos = currentPos.translate(dirs[choice].deltaX, dirs[choice].deltaY);
3338            path.add(0, currentPos);
3339            frustration++;
3340
3341            if (gradientMap[currentPos.x][currentPos.y] == 0)
3342                break;
3343        }
3344        cutShort = false;
3345        frustration = 0;
3346        if(buffer == null)
3347            return new ArrayList<>(path);
3348        else
3349        {
3350            buffer.addAll(path);
3351            return buffer;
3352        }
3353
3354    }
3355
3356    /**
3357     * A simple limited flood-fill that returns a OrderedMap of Coord keys to the Double values in the DijkstraMap, only
3358     * calculating out to a number of steps determined by limit. This can be useful if you need many flood-fills and
3359     * don't need a large area for each, or if you want to have an effect spread to a certain number of cells away.
3360     *
3361     * @param radius the number of steps to take outward from each starting position.
3362     * @param starts a vararg group of Points to step outward from; this often will only need to be one Coord.
3363     * @return A OrderedMap of Coord keys to Double values; the starts are included in this with the value 0.0.
3364     */
3365    public OrderedMap<Coord, Double> floodFill(int radius, Coord... starts) {
3366        if (!initialized) return null;
3367        OrderedMap<Coord, Double> fill = new OrderedMap<>();
3368
3369        resetMap();
3370        for (Coord goal : starts) {
3371            setGoal(goal.x, goal.y);
3372        }
3373        if (goals.isEmpty())
3374            return fill;
3375
3376        partialScan(radius, null);
3377        double temp;
3378        for (int x = 1; x < width - 1; x++) {
3379            for (int y = 1; y < height - 1; y++) {
3380                temp = gradientMap[x][y];
3381                if (temp < FLOOR) {
3382                    fill.put(Coord.get(x, y), temp);
3383                }
3384            }
3385        }
3386        goals.clear();
3387        return fill;
3388    }
3389
3390    public int getMappedCount() {
3391        return mappedCount;
3392    }
3393
3394    /**
3395     * If you want obstacles present in orthogonal cells to prevent pathfinding along the diagonal between them, this
3396     * can be used to make thin diagonal walls non-viable to move through, or even to prevent diagonal movement if any
3397     * one obstacle is orthogonally adjacent to both the start and target cell of a diagonal move. If you haven't set
3398     * this yet, then the default is 2.
3399     * <br>
3400     * If this is 0, as a special case no orthogonal obstacles will block diagonal moves.
3401     * <br>
3402     * If this is 1, having one orthogonal obstacle adjacent to both the current cell and the cell the pathfinder is
3403     * trying to diagonally enter will block diagonal moves. This generally blocks movement around corners, the "hard
3404     * corner" rule used in some games.
3405     * <br>
3406     * If this is 2 (the default), having two orthogonal obstacles adjacent to both the current cell and the cell the
3407     * pathfinder is trying to diagonally enter will block diagonal moves. As an example, if there is a wall to the
3408     * north and a wall to the east, then the pathfinder won't be able to move northeast even if there is a floor there.
3409     * @return the current level of blocking required to stop a diagonal move
3410     */
3411    public int getBlockingRequirement() {
3412        return blockingRequirement;
3413    }
3414
3415    /**
3416     * If you want obstacles present in orthogonal cells to prevent pathfinding along the diagonal between them, this
3417     * can be used to make thin diagonal walls non-viable to move through, or even to prevent diagonal movement if any
3418     * one obstacle is orthogonally adjacent to both the start and target cell of a diagonal move. If you haven't set
3419     * this yet, then the default is 2.
3420     * <br>
3421     * If this is 0, as a special case no orthogonal obstacles will block diagonal moves.
3422     * <br>
3423     * If this is 1, having one orthogonal obstacle adjacent to both the current cell and the cell the pathfinder is
3424     * trying to diagonally enter will block diagonal moves. This generally blocks movement around corners, the "hard
3425     * corner" rule used in some games.
3426     * <br>
3427     * If this is 2 (the default), having two orthogonal obstacles adjacent to both the current cell and the cell the
3428     * pathfinder is trying to diagonally enter will block diagonal moves. As an example, if there is a wall to the
3429     * north and a wall to the east, then the pathfinder won't be able to move northeast even if there is a floor there.
3430     * @param blockingRequirement the desired level of blocking required to stop a diagonal move
3431     */
3432    public void setBlockingRequirement(int blockingRequirement) {
3433        this.blockingRequirement = blockingRequirement > 2 ? 2 : Math.max(blockingRequirement, 0);
3434    }
3435
3436    private void appendDirToShuffle(IRNG rng) {
3437        final Direction[] src = measurement == Measurement.MANHATTAN
3438                ? Direction.CARDINALS : Direction.OUTWARDS;
3439        final int n = measurement.directionCount();
3440        System.arraycopy(src, 0, dirs, 0, n);
3441        for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; i--) {
3442            final int r = rng.nextInt(i+1);
3443            Direction t = dirs[r];
3444            dirs[r] = dirs[i];
3445            dirs[i] = t;
3446        }
3447        dirs[n] = Direction.NONE;
3448    }
3449}
